name: reimage
content:
reimage verb [I or T]
(APPEARANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
business
  specialized to change the way that an organization, company, or product is seen by the public: The firm had spent £6 million in an attempt to reimage itself. The company revealed its plans to reimage all of its retail outlets.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen you are trying to reimage a place, it is important to gain the attention of your target market.

reimage verb [I or T]
(COMPUTER)
computing
  specialized to run a program that deals with any problems on a computer and makes sure that it is using the most suitable programs: The best solution to the problem is to reimage your hard disk. They reimaged the computers to remove any viruses. If you follow these instructions, there will be no need to reimage.
More examplesFewer examplesI usually just reimage my computer so that I don't have to reinstall any apps.I'd advise you to reimage your laptop now to make sure that nothing has been compromised.You can re-image a server in around 20 minutes.
